content.title: Internship Scheme For Students Of Counselling/ Psychology/ Social Work/ Home Science Etc
content.department: Directorate of Women and Child Development
content.details: This is an Internship Scheme by the Directorate of Women and Child Development, Government of Goa. The objective of this scheme is to offer aspiring postgraduate students an opportunity for internship facilities to be trained as qualified interns in state-run private children's and shelter homes who can be offered hands-on job training experience. The scheme is open to any student who has passed out from any of the recognised universities with a Master's Degree in Social Service/ Social Work/ Sociology/ Psychology/ Home Science/ Post Graduate Diploma in Counselling etc.
benefits: One paid leave per month during the training period
eligibility: The applicant should have passed out from any of the recognised universities with a Master's Degree.
The Master's Degree should have been in Social Service/ Social Work/ Sociology/ Psychology/ Home Science/ Post Graduate Diploma in Counselling etc.
The applicant should have passed out as a post-graduate within three years prior to applying for the internship.
The applicant should have obtained at least 50% marks in aggregate in the final year of the postgraduation.
content.application_process: Offline. Step 1: Take the print of the format of the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest if required). Step 2: The applicant should send the application to: Director, Directorate of Women And Child Development, Panaji-Goa, 2nd floor, Old Education Building, 18th June Road, Altinho, Panaji, Goa - 403 001.
documents_required: Proof of Educational Qualification (Post Graduate Degree and attested copy of Marksheets of the PostGraduate course)
Proof of Work/ Field Work Experience (if any)

faqs.question: Can The Internship Be Converted Into A Full-Time Job Or Lead To Regular Employment With The Women And Child Development Department After Completion?
faqs.answer: No, the internship does not guarantee conversion into a full-time job or regular employment.

faqs.question: I Read About The Requirement To Sign A Bond. Can You Explain The Purpose Of The Bond?
faqs.answer: The bond ensures completing the internship without breaks. It's valued at one month's allowance.

faqs.question: Can Interns Be Terminated From The Program?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Director has the right to terminate an intern's participation in the program.

faqs.question: Is This Internship Exclusively For Female Candidates?
faqs.answer: The scheme does not impose any gender-based restrictions.

faqs.question: What Documents Are Required For Applying To This Internship Program?
faqs.answer: The required documents include a passport size photograph, birth certificate, educational qualification proof, and proof of work or field work experience.

faqs.question: Are Interns Entitled To Any Leaves During The Training Period?
faqs.answer: Interns are entitled to one paid leave per month during the training period.

faqs.question: Is There A Stipend Or Allowance Provided To The Interns During The Internship Period?
faqs.answer: Yes, the selected student interns will receive a monthly internship allowance of ₹15,000/-.

faqs.question: What Will Be The Supervision And Reporting Process During The Internship?
faqs.answer: Interns will work under the total supervision of the officers in charge at their respective place of deployment.

faqs.question: Where Will The Selected Intern Students Work During Their Internship?
faqs.answer: The selected intern students will work at various locations, including State-Run Children's Home, Protective Home for Women, and Juvenile Justice Boards.

faqs.question: What Is The Total Number Of Internship Slots Available Each Year?
faqs.answer: The total number of slots for interns is fixed at 15 per year, extendable up to 20.
